title: A Distant Voice

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Yune? What is it? Where are you going?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Incredible! Sothe:  Mounds of treasure! Maybe it was the gold calling you, Micaiah?
Grrruah! What is this?! Looks like a tasty snack turned up while we were out!

intro.speaker: Pain
intro.line: Mwah-ha-ha! Our first prey in a long time. Leave them to me, my fang-brothers!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Not good. Laguz bandits! Micaiah, give the signal.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Sothe, have you noticed…

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Yes. Ever since we arrived here.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: What should we do?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Hmm, I can’t sense any malice. Whoever it is doesn’t seem to mean us any harm, but… Yes, let’s do it.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: All right. On three, then. One…two…three!
Ahh!

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Hey!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: There, now we can see your face.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: You’re…a girl?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: I-I’m sorry!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: No! Wait! Please don’t run!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: My name is Micaiah. Don’t be afraid.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Have you gone mad? Don’t tell her your name! We’re on the run, remember?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: It’s all right. She’s not after us.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Thie is my…brother, Sothe. We’re from Nevassa.

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Oh…uhh…hi there.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: And you are?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: I’m Meg.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: What are you doing out here on the edge of the desert?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: I’m looking for someone. Someone very important. Someone close to my heart…

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: All by yourself?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Yes.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: You’re meeting someone way out here?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: I’m not sure, exactly. All I know is that this is where he came before he disappeared. I thought maybe he went into the desert…

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What a coincidence. We’re also looking for someone in the desert. Would you like to come along?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Really? Are you sure?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Of course.

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Oh, thank you! I’ve been so lonely since I left Crimea all on my own.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: You came all the way from Crimea? I’m surprised you made it this far.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: That’s it then. Welcome aboard, Meg. You’re one of us now.

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Oh, there you are. Can we have a word with you?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Aimee, Muston. How may I help you?

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Relax, honey. I’m here to tell you about our business. You like to shop, don’t you?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Let me guess, you want to sell us weapons and other items. Am I right?

conversation.speaker: Muston
conversation.line: That’s right. Our inventory changes depending on where we are and what time it is. But one thing is always the same. We guarantee fair prices! So stop by whenever you can.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Do you carry tomes?

conversation.speaker: Muston
conversation.line: Yup. Fire, Thunder, Wind, Light… we’ve got your basics covered.

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: My shop also has lots of staves and medicine. Oh, and I have recently made some…key connections. Now I carry some very rare items. They’re one of a kind, and very valuable. You should come have a look! Rare weapons too. Honestly, you should buy them, before someone else does! At these prices, they’re bound to sell quickly.

conversation.speaker: Muston
conversation.line: Well, that’s our spiel. Thanks for listening.

conversation.speaker: Aimee
conversation.line: Do come by! We’ll be waiting.

conversation.speaker: Jorge
conversation.line: Well, hello! Don’t mind us. We won’t take but a moment of your time…

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Hello, Jorge. Hello, Daniel.

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: We just wanted to tell you a little about what we can do for YOU.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I’ve already told her. Jorge will buy from us any items or weapons that we no longer need. And Daniel--

conversation.speaker: Jorge
conversation.line: Hey! Excuse me, we’re here to talk to Micaiah! Not to some stuffy, know-it-all pun--

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: Jorge, don’t be rude! I’m sorry about that, Sothe. Anyway, we just wanted to tell you about some changes we made to out business.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: All right, then. I’ll keep my mouth shut as long as Daniel does the talking.

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: Thank you.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: So, what do you have, Daniel?

conversation.speaker: Jorge
conversation.line: Hey, thanks for asking! I’ve got a guy who’s a master blacksmith. He makes weapons you wouldn’t believe…and they’re not available anywhere else!

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: Hey, thanks a lot, Jorge! I make weapons too…pretty good ones, if I do say so myself! It’s just, you know, customs have been extremely tight lately…raw materials are so hard to come by… Which reminds me, if you ever have weapons you don’t need, would you sell them to us?

conversation.speaker: Jorge
conversation.line: Yes, please. Actually, even better…sell me your weapons, and I’ll give them to Daniel. Then he can smelt them down and use the steel for newer, shinier, pieces!

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: It costs some money to upgrade weapons, but… But hey, let’s face it, it’s worth the money. Owning a custom-made weapon sets you apart from the common soldier!

conversation.speaker: Jorge
conversation.line: Oh, and here’s a one-time-only deal! I won’t even charge you for the materials on your first upgrade! Pretty nice, huh? Now you have no excuse not to come by. Got that, Micaiah?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Umm…yes. Thank you.

conversation.speaker: Daniel
conversation.line: One last thing. If you ever bring me a coin, I’ll give you a little bonus on whatever I’m making for you. They’re very rare, so be sure to hang on to them. Don’t sell them to some stranger!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What are you doing out here, Kurth?

conversation.speaker: Kurth
conversation.line: Hello, Micaiah. Pay me no mind. I’m just watching the desert. How the wind changes the sandscape…The ebb and flow of the dunes, like giant swells in the ocean. I find it mesmerizing.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Is this your first time in the desert?

conversation.speaker: Kurth
conversation.line: Yes. My homeland is ringed with mountains. Everything about Daein looks new and curious to my eyes.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I see.

conversation.speaker: Kurth
conversation.line: …You have not asked.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I’m sorry?

conversation.speaker: Kurth
conversation.line: You have not asked me who I am or where I am from. Not just you, Micaiah, but the others as well. No one seeks to know who I am.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: You seem to not want to talk about yourself. Am I right?

conversation.speaker: Kurth
conversation.line: Yes… Quite right.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: That’s why no one asks. People can tell when someone wants privacy. Many of us desire privacy too. Kurth, you are not our enemy. I know that much. You’re kind and gentle. That is all I need to know.

conversation.speaker: Kurth
conversation.line: Thank you…

boss.speaker: Pain
boss.line: Mwah-ha-ha! Come here so I can taste you!

boss.speaker: Pain
boss.line: Mwah...ha...ha-- Gnk! How did this happen?

boss.speaker: Agony
boss.line: Grrruah! Puny little humans, come and fight!

boss.speaker: Micaiah
boss.line: Listen up! We did not intentionally intrude on your territory.

boss.speaker: Pain
boss.line: Mwah-ha-ha! I'll listen...while I'm gnawing on your bones!

boss.speaker: Agony
boss.line: Oooohhhh...a beorc mage. Shiny, sparkly magic makes me soooo scared.

boss.speaker: Micaiah
boss.line: We do not want your treasures, and we mean no ill will. Step back, and we will not harm you.

boss.speaker: Agony
boss.line: If the fire don't roar like a furnace, it don't scare me! Mwah-ha-ha! I'm gonna rip your throat out!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Yune? Yune, where are you? You can come out now!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: You and that bird. It's...a little strange.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: You're just jealous. Wait, I hear something.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: I can't hear anything.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Someone's singing. It's coming from over there.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Micaiah, wait!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: You! Hello! Who are you?

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: I am Rafiel. A voice guided me here. Was it yours?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: No. But I heard a voice that guided me here as well. Someone or something may want us both here.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: You're laguz, aren't you? One of the heron clan, and two of the beast tribe. Right?

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: That is correct, beorc youth.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Your white wings reveal you're of the heron royal family. Are you related to Prince Reyson by any chance?

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: Reyson? My younger brother? You know of him?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: You could say that. We served in the same company for a while.

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: What? You are suggesting that my brother is still alive?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Yes. He is still alive. And as far as I know, your father the king and the princess Leanne are as well. Unless something's happened, all three of them live in the royal palace of Gallia, country of the beast tribe.

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: Unbelievable! My father and sweet Leanne... They're still with me! Oh, goddess! I'm...not alone. Not anymore... ...Ah...

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: Rafiel...

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Hello. And you are?

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: I am Nailah, Queen of Hatari, and this is Volug, my loyal servant. Our kingdom lies far east of here.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: There's a country on the other side of the desert?

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: As I said. We have just traveled from there. Until we met Rafiel, we didn't know there were countries on this side of the desert. After all, no one had ever crossed the Desert of Death and lived to tell of it. Without Rafiel's guidance, we would never have survived the crossing.

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: My people, the heron clan of Serenes, were blamed for the murder of Begnion's empress. Begnion mobs rose up in rage and massacred them. I had thought the whole of my clan, my entire race, had been wiped out. I wandered the desert in despair. If not for the queen, I would have died. In Hatari, I vowed to dedicate my life to her. And yet every night for these past three years, a voice has called out to me. Day by day, it has grown stronger... Until the voice led me to you all. Your news brings such joy! Father...Reyson...Leanne... My beloved family... My thanks to thee, O goddess... Ah...

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: Rafiel... You talk too much. Control yourself. You, beorc... What's the best route to Gallia?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: For a group of laguz, traveling through the Daein countryside would be suicide. It will take you longer, but we could take you as far as Crimea.

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: We would be grateful. By all means, let's travel together. But why go to Crimea? Why not travel directly to Gallia?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Entering Gallia by yourselves would be nearly impossible. The man you need to get you into Gallia actually resides in Crimea. That man, Ike, is in contact with King Caineghis and his advisors. There's no doubt in my mind that he's the man you need.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Right. Lord Ike, "hero" of the Crimean Liberation, leader of the Greil Mercenaries, and father of Sothe's children...

narration: The history of Tellius is a history of warfare, or so the troubadours sing. It is a history of unending conflict between the beorc and the laguz, a history penned in blood and scarred by mistrust. The beorc fight with the weapons of man--the sword, the axe, the lance, and the magic arts, while the laguz, able to transform into beast, bird, and dragon, are weapons unto themselves. Both were created equally by the goddess, but neither race has ever accepted the other.
The heron prince Rafiel, the wolf queen of Hatari, Nailah, and her vassal, Volug. Is the Dawn Brigade's meeting with these three chance...or a sign of things to come? Micaiah can only wonder.
